intro: Eriocaulon spathaceum, commonly known as the grassy spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poales. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy environments, thriving in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a smooth texture, while the stems are often clustered at the base. Eriocaulon spathaceum plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetlands and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
